solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1 Open the Settings menu in Google Chrome Step 2 Click on Show Advanced Settings. Step 3 Select Clear Browsing Data under the Privacy section. Step 4 Select the following: Cookies and other site and plugins Cached images and files Obliterate the following items from: the beginning of time. Click Clear Browsing Data Step 5 Restart your browser.
solution-article.description:
Step 1



Open the Settings menu in Google Chrome

Step 2



Click on Show Advanced Settings.

Step 3



Select Clear Browsing Data under the Privacy section.


Step 4


Select the following:

  • Cookies and other site and plugins
  • Cached images and files
  • Obliterate the following items from: the beginning of time.
  • Click Clear Browsing Data

Step 5


Restart your browser.
solution-article.title: How do I clear the Cache?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1 From the Body Corporate home page, click Super Search. You may be in any Body Corporate when entering the Super Search menu. Step 2 Select "ALL" to search across all Bodies Corporate. Enter a description of what you are looking for, from one of the following inputs: - Invoice - CInvoice - Receipt - CPayment - GL Click Search to begin the search. Step 3 A list of all results across all Bodies Corporate will be displayed. Click "SELECT" for the transaction you are looking for to be redirected to its menu.
solution-article.description:
Step 1



From the Body Corporate home page, click Super Search.

You may be in any Body Corporate when entering the Super Search menu. 

Step 2



Select "ALL" to search across all Bodies Corporate.

Enter a description of what you are looking for, from one of the following inputs:

- Invoice

- CInvoice

- Receipt

- CPayment

- GL

Click Search to begin the search. 

Step 3



A list of all results across all Bodies Corporate will be displayed. 

Click "SELECT" for the transaction you are looking for to be redirected to its menu.
solution-article.title: How can I search for items across all Bodies Corporate?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Enter the Username and Password that was provided to you by Uxtrata. Select the Body Corporate you would like to work on Click the Login button If you do not have this, please contact support@uxtrata.com

solution-article.title: Login into Uxtrata

solution-article.desc-un-html: PLEASE NOTE: - This action can NOT be reversed. - All transactions before the financial close off date can NOT be edited. - Transactions can NOT be created for a date prior to the financial close off date. Step 1 Click Edit from the home page. Step 2 Click on Close Date Step 3 You will be prompted to enter the System Pin. Step 4 Select the Close Date. Click Submit. Step 5 The Close Date will be shown in the home page once submitted. You have successfully closed off the financial period.
solution-article.description:
PLEASE NOTE:

- This action can NOT be reversed.

- All transactions before the financial close off date can NOT be edited.

- Transactions can NOT be created for a date prior to the financial close off date.

Step 1



Click Edit from the home page. 

Step 2



Click on Close Date

Step 3



You will be prompted to enter the System Pin. 


Step 4



Select the Close Date.

Click Submit.



Step 5



The Close Date will be shown in the home page once submitted. 

You have successfully closed off the financial period.
solution-article.title: How to Close the Financial Period

solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1: Select Edit from the Uxtrata homepage. Step 2: Select Close Date. Enter PIN and select Submit. Step 3: Select the date you wish to change close off date to. Select Submit.
solution-article.description:
Step 1:

Select Edit from the Uxtrata homepage.

Step 2:

Select Close Date.

Enter PIN and select Submit.

Step 3:

  • Select the date you wish to change close off date to.
  • Select Submit.
solution-article.title: How to Reverse Financial Period

solution-article.desc-un-html:
Step 1: Enter the Invoices Menu under Accounts Receivable Step 2: Click on Add to create a new Invoice Step 3:
Invoice Number will be generated automatically.
Select the Unit you wish to charge the levy to. The Debtor field will be completed automatically. Enter the Invoice Date, Due Date and Apply Dated. Add a Description if required. Click on the + icon at the bottom of the page and select the expense from the chart of accounts drop down menu. Enter the Gross amount ONLY. Select GST if the expense is GST inclusive. The Net and Tax columns will be calculated automatically when you click save. Click on the save icon at the bottom of the page to confirm the expense item. Step 4: Click Save to create the invoice in Uxtrata Core.
solution-article.description:
Step 1:



Enter the Invoices Menu under Accounts Receivable


Step 2:



Click on Add to create a new Invoice


Step 3:



  1. Invoice Number will be generated automatically.
  2. Select the Unit you wish to charge the levy to.
  3. The Debtor field will be completed automatically.
  4. Enter the Invoice Date, Due Date and Apply Dated.
  5. Add a Description if required.
  6. Click on the + icon at the bottom of the page and select the expense from the chart of accounts drop down menu.
  7. Enter the Gross amount ONLY.
  8. Select GST if the expense is GST inclusive.
  9. The Net and Tax columns will be calculated automatically when you click save.
  10. Click on the save icon at the bottom of the page to confirm the expense item.

Step 4:



Click Save to create the invoice in Uxtrata Core.
solution-article.title: Creating a Single Special Levy/ Invoice

solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1: Enter the Invoices Menu under Accounts Receivable Step 2: Click on Standard Template to download the CSV template file. Step 3: Complete the CSV template file. Step 4: Enter the Import menu Step 5: Click Choose File to select the the CSV Template File from your computer. Click Import to import the data into Uxtrata Core. A batch of invoices will be created from the data submitted in the template.
solution-article.description:
Step 1:



Enter the Invoices Menu under Accounts Receivable


Step 2:



Click on Standard Template to download the CSV template file.


Step 3:



Complete the CSV template file.

Step 4:



Enter the Import menu

Step 5:



  • Click Choose File to select the the CSV Template File from your computer.
  • Click Import to import the data into Uxtrata Core.
  • A batch of invoices will be created from the data submitted in the template.
solution-article.title: Creating a Batch Special Levy/ Invoice

solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1 Enter the Receipts menu under the Accounts Receivable Tab. Step 2 Select the transaction you would like to allocate a discount to and click Allocate. Step 3 Allocate the Discount Select the allocated transaction. Click Edit Enter the discount amount or simply click the ‘10% discount’ area to automatically fill this field. Click the ‘save’ icon at the bottom of the page to confirm changes. Click 'Save' on the top left menu to save all details.
solution-article.description:
Step 1



Enter the Receipts menu under the Accounts Receivable Tab.

Step 2



Select the transaction you would like to allocate a discount to and click Allocate.

Step 3

Allocate the Discount



  1. Select the allocated transaction.
  2. Click Edit
  3. Enter the discount amount or simply click the ‘10% discount’ area to automatically fill this field.
  4. Click the ‘save’ icon at the bottom of the page to confirm changes.
  5. Click 'Save' on the top left menu to save all details.
solution-article.title: Allocate a Discount

solution-article.desc-un-html: Method 1 (For Bulk Download) Step 1 Enter the Accounts Receivable Invoice menu. Step 2 Select the batch of invoices you would like to print/ save and click Export. Step 3 Select In One PDF to save all invoices into one PDF file. Select In Separate PDFs if you wish to save each invoice within the batch as individual PDF files. Files will be saved into your Uxtrata Drive. Method 2 (For Individual Download) Step 1 Enter Invoices Menu. Step 2 Select the batch of invoices you would like to print/ save and click Details Step 3 Select the invoice you wish to save/ download and click Export. (please ensure pop-ups are NOT blocked)
solution-article.description:
Method 1 (For Bulk Download)

Step 1



Enter the Accounts Receivable Invoice menu. 

Step 2


Select the batch of invoices you would like to print/ save and click Export.

Step 3


Select In One PDF to save all invoices into one PDF file.

Select In Separate PDFs if you wish to save each invoice within the batch as individual PDF files.

Files will be saved into your Uxtrata Drive. 

Method 2 (For Individual Download)

Step 1



Enter Invoices Menu.

Step 2



Select the batch of invoices you would like to print/ save and click Details

Step 3



Select the invoice you wish to save/ download and click Export.

(please ensure pop-ups are NOT blocked)
solution-article.title: How to Download Levies

solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1 Enter the Invoices menu in the Accounts Receivable tab. Step 2 Select the batch of invoices you would like to edit the description for, and click Edit. Step 3 Select the expense item and click Edit. Step 4 Enter the Description you would like to appear in Levy. Click the Save icon at the bottom of the page. Click the Save button on the left hand menu. Step 5 Any changes made will be applied to ALL invoices within the selected batch.

solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1: Enter the Levies menu from the home page. Step 2: Select the Begin and End date for the levy. Step 3: Select Budget Levy. Step 4: Select All for all budget items, or Expenses for expense budgeted items only. Step 5: Select Add New Row to add additional budget items. Step 6: Enter information on the budget item. Step 7: Click on the Save icon at the bottom of the page to save budget item. Step 8: Select Next Step. Step 9: Enter the number of Instalments and the Dates for each Instalment. Click Default Description and OK. Step 10: Enter Billing Date, Due Date, and Apply Date. Apply Date is the same as Billing Date. Step 11: Tick Box and select Fill to evenly divide the budget total into each instalment. Step 12: Select Submit to save levy/invoice.
solution-article.description:
Step 1:


Enter the Levies menu from the home page.

Step 2:

Select the Begin and End date for the levy.

Step 3:


Select Budget Levy.

Step 4:


Select All for all budget items, or Expenses for expense budgeted items only.

 Step 5:


Select Add New Row to add additional budget items.

Step 6:

Enter information on the budget item. 

Step 7:


Click on the Save icon at the bottom of the page to save budget item.

Step 8:


Select Next Step.

Step 9:


Enter the number of Instalments and the Dates for each Instalment. Click Default Description and OK.

Step 10:

Enter Billing Date, Due Date, and Apply Date. Apply Date is the same as Billing Date.

Step 11:


Tick Box and select Fill to evenly divide the budget total into each instalment.

 Step 12:

Select Submit to save levy/invoice.
solution-article.title: Creating a Standard Levy/Invoice

solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1: Enter the Invoices Menu under Accounts Receivable. Step 2: Click Add on main page. Step 3: Fill out everything: Num is the invoice number, it is automatically generated but you can overwrite it. Bodycorp is automatically generated and fixed. Unit is the unit that you want to charge, after selecting Unit, Debtor will be filled out. If Debtor does not own the Unit, select Unit Null. Apply Date is when the invoice is applied to the accounts. By default, it is set as same as the Invoice Date. Leave Sent box unticked, it will automatically be ticked when sent out to debtor with our invoice send function. Enter Description for your reference. Step 4: Click on the + icon at the bottom of the page. Step 5: Enter Description, it will show up in the invoice. Enter Net, Tax, Gross value. Or enter Gross only, others will auto-fill. Tick GST box if body corporate is GST registered. Step 6: Click the Save icon at the bottom of the page to confirm. Step 7: Click Save.
solution-article.description:
Step 1:


Enter the Invoices Menu under Accounts Receivable.

Step 2:


Click Add on main page.

Step 3:


Fill out everything:

  • Num is the invoice number, it is automatically generated but you can overwrite it.
  • Bodycorp is automatically generated and fixed.
  • Unit is the unit that you want to charge, after selecting Unit, Debtor will be filled out.
  • If Debtor does not own the Unit, select Unit Null.
  • Apply Date is when the invoice is applied to the accounts. By default, it is set as same as the Invoice Date.
  • Leave Sent box unticked, it will automatically be ticked when sent out to debtor with our invoice send function.
  • Enter Description for your reference.

Step 4:


Click on the + icon at the bottom of the page.

Step 5:


  • Enter Description, it will show up in the invoice.  
  • Enter Net, Tax, Gross value. Or enter Gross only, others will auto-fill. 
  • Tick GST box if body corporate is GST registered.

Step 6:


Click the Save icon at the bottom of the page to confirm.

Step 7:


Click Save.
solution-article.title: How To Create a Debtor Invoice [Single]

solution-article.desc-un-html:
Step 1: Enter the Invoices Menu under Accounts Receivable. Step 2: Click on Export. Step 3: Choose All or Print Only.
Print Only will export levies only for unit owners who have print as their preferred communication channel.
All will export invoices for all unit owners. Step 4: Select In One PDF to have all the invoices combined into a single PDF file. Select In Separate PDFs to have the invoices exported in separate PDF files. The PDF files will be saved to your Uxtrata Drive.
solution-article.description:
Step 1:



Enter the Invoices Menu under Accounts Receivable.

Step 2:

Click on Export.

Step 3:


  • Choose All or Print Only.

  • Print Only will export levies only for unit owners who have print as their preferred communication channel. 
  • All will export invoices for all unit owners. 

Step 4:


  • Select In One PDF to have all the invoices combined into a single PDF file. 
  • Select In Separate PDFs to have the invoices exported in separate PDF files. 
  • The PDF files will be saved to your Uxtrata Drive.

solution-article.desc-un-html: Example The debtor has paid the full amount ($4800) of a levy before due date, accidentally ignoring the discount amount. You want to ensure that the debtor still receives the discount and the remainder of the paid amount is stored as credit. Step 1 Enter the Receipts menu under Accounts Receivable. Step 2 Select the appropriate receipt and click "Allocate" Step 3 Select the corresponding Invoice from the Outstanding Transactions and click the upwards pointing arrow. Step 4 Select the invoice and click edit. Click the 10% Discount to automatically fill the discount amount. Adjust the Paid amount so that the Paid + Discount amount equals the Gross Amount. Click the Save icon. Click the Save button to confirm changes. Note: The non-allocated amount will be stored in the debtors account as a credit.
solution-article.description:
Example


The debtor has paid the full amount ($4800) of a levy before due date, accidentally ignoring the discount amount. 

You want to ensure that the debtor still receives the discount and the remainder of the paid amount is stored as credit. 

Step 1



Enter the Receipts menu under Accounts Receivable. 


Step 2



Select the appropriate receipt and click "Allocate"

Step 3




Select the corresponding Invoice from the Outstanding Transactions and click the upwards pointing arrow.

Step 4



  • Select the invoice and click edit. 
  • Click the 10% Discount to automatically fill the discount amount. 
  • Adjust the Paid amount so that the Paid + Discount amount equals the Gross Amount.
  • Click the Save icon. 
  • Click the Save button to confirm changes. 

Note: The non-allocated amount will be stored in the debtors account as a credit.
solution-article.title: How to Allocate Part of a Receipt

solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1: Enter the Invoice Send menu under Accounts Receivable. Step 2: Tick box and select the Date period that includes the date of the levy you want to send. Select Load. Step 3: Tick the invoice that you want to send. Click Create Attachment. Step 4: Invoice will be shown as Ready. Enter Email Subject and Email Body. This will be seen by all recipients. Step 5: Tick the invoice that you want to send. Click Send Email. Step 6: You will get a summary of invoices sent. Keep a copy for future reference. Choose preferred format e.g. Excel, PDF, Word Note: Ensure pop-up blocker is disabled.
solution-article.description:

Enter the Invoice Send menu under Accounts Receivable.

Step 3:

Click Create Attachment.

Step 4:

Invoice will be shown as Ready.


Enter Email Subject and Email Body. This will be seen by all recipients. 

Step 5:

Click Send Email.

Step 6:

  • Choose preferred format e.g. Excel, PDF, Word

Note: Ensure pop-up blocker is disabled.

Enter Salutation- how they are addressed in written communication created by Uxtrata.

Enter the Debtors menu from the Uxtrata home page.

Select Add.

Note: Email needs to be ticked for debtor to receive email correspondence.

Step 4:

Select Save to confirm.

solution-article.desc-un-html:
Step 1 Create Creditor Invoice and select the unit you wish to On Charge part of the invoice to. A debtor invoice to the unit will be created automatically. In this example, we will use $10,000 as the total invoice amount and $5,000 as the amount to on charge to Unit A. Step 2 Go into the Accounts Receivable - Invoice menu, select the automatically generated invoice and click Details. Step 3 Select the invoice and click Details. Step 4 Click Edit Step 5 Click on the Edit button. Adjust the amount you wish to charge to the unit ($5,000). Click the Save icon at the bottom of the page to confirm changes to the amount.
Click the Save button on the left hand menu to save changes made to this invoices.
solution-article.description:
Step 1



Create Creditor Invoice and select the unit you wish to On Charge part of the invoice to.

A debtor invoice to the unit will be created automatically.

In this example, we will use $10,000 as the total invoice amount and $5,000 as the amount to on charge to Unit A.

 Step 2



Go into the Accounts Receivable - Invoice menu, select the automatically generated invoice and click Details.

Step 3



Select the invoice and click Details.

Step 4



Click Edit

Step 5



  • Click on the Edit button.
  • Adjust the amount you wish to charge to the unit ($5,000).
  • Click the Save icon at the bottom of the page to confirm changes to the amount.
  • Click the Save button on the left hand menu to save changes made to this invoices.
solution-article.title: OnCharge a Partial Amount of Creditor Invoice

solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1 Go to the Invoices menu under the Accounts Payable tab. Step 2 Click Add to create a new Creditor Invoice Step 3 Create Creditor Invoice and select the unit you wish to On Charge part of the invoice to. A debtor invoice to the unit will be created automatically. Step 4 Go into the Accounts Receivable - Invoice menu, select the automatically generated invoice and click Details. Step 5 Here you will see the on charged invoice. Click details to view more information about this invoice.
solution-article.description:
Step 1



Go to the Invoices menu under the Accounts Payable tab.

Step 2



Click Add to create a new Creditor Invoice

Step 3



Create Creditor Invoice and select the unit you wish to On Charge part of the invoice to.

A debtor invoice to the unit will be created automatically.

Step 4




Go into the Accounts Receivable - Invoice menu, select the automatically generated invoice and click Details.

Step 5



Here you will see the on charged invoice. Click details to view more information about this invoice.

solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1: Enter the CCredit Notes Menu under Accounts Payable. Step 2: Click Add to create a new Credit Note. Step 3: Credit Note Number will be automatically generated, you can manually override this if necessary. Select the Creditor who issued the credit note. Enter the Date the Credit Note was issued. Click the + icon in the bottom menu. Select the corresponding Chart Code. Enter the Gross amount of the credit note. Tick the GST tickbox if it is GST inclusive. Click the save icon in the bottom menu. Click Save on the left hand menu to confirm the Credit Note.
solution-article.description:
Step 1:



Enter the CCredit Notes Menu under Accounts Payable.

Step 2:



Click Add to create a new Credit Note.


Step 3:



  1. Credit Note Number will be automatically generated, you can manually override this if necessary.
  2. Select the Creditor who issued the credit note. 
  3. Enter the Date the Credit Note was issued. 
  4. Click the + icon in the bottom menu.
  5. Select the corresponding Chart Code.
  6. Enter the Gross amount of the credit note. 
  7. Tick the GST tickbox if it is GST inclusive. 
  8. Click the save icon in the bottom menu. 
  9. Click Save on the left hand menu to confirm the Credit Note.

Enter Invoice Date, Due Date, and Apply Date.
Enter a Description if necessary.
Enter the payment transaction by selecting the + icon at the bottom o fht epage. Select the payment from the drop-down menu and enter Description. Enter the Gross amount only.   4. Enter Invoice Date, Due Date, and Apply Date.
  5. Enter a Description if necessary.
  6. Enter the payment transaction by selecting the + icon at the bottom o fht epage.
  7. Select the payment from the drop-down menu and enter Description.
  8. Enter the Gross amount only.
  9. Tick GST box if the payment is GST inclusive.
  10. The Net and Tax columns will be calculated automatically when you select save.
  11. Select the save icon at the bottom of the page.

Step 4:

Click Save to create the invoice in Uxtrata Core.

solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1: Enter the Reconciliation menu from the Uxtrata homepage. Step 2: Select the bank Account you wish to reconcile. Select the Cutoff Date. Enter the closing balance. Select Reconciliation. Step 3a: Select the unreconciled transaction and select the upward pointing arrow. It should now balance. Note: Closing On Statement must match Closing Balance. Step 3b: If transaction does not exist, select Insert to create a new transaction. Please refer to the following links on how to create a new transaction for : Receipt https://uxtrata.freshdesk.com/solution/articles/30000026330-how-to-create-a-receipt-method-3-banking-menu- Payment https://uxtrata.freshdesk.com/solution/articles/30000026332-how-to-create-a-creditor-payment-method-1-banking-menu- Cash Deposit https://uxtrata.freshdesk.com/solution/articles/30000026331-how-to-record-a-cash-deposit Cash Payment https://uxtrata.freshdesk.com/solution/articles/30000026333-how-to-record-a-cash-payment Once you are done, select Insert. Or, Select Import. Step 4: Select Save to confirm changes.
solution-article.description:
Step 1:

Enter the Reconciliation menu from the Uxtrata homepage.

Step 2:

  • Select the bank Account you wish to reconcile.
  • Select the Cutoff Date.
  • Enter the closing balance.


Select Reconciliation.

Step 3a:

  • Select the unreconciled transaction and select the upward pointing arrow.
  • It should now balance.

Note: Closing On Statement must match Closing Balance.

Step 3b:

If transaction does not exist, select Insert to create a new transaction.


Please refer to the following links on how to create a new transaction for :

  1. Receipt https://uxtrata.freshdesk.com/solution/articles/30000026330-how-to-create-a-receipt-method-3-banking-menu-
  2. Payment https://uxtrata.freshdesk.com/solution/articles/30000026332-how-to-create-a-creditor-payment-method-1-banking-menu-
  3. Cash Deposit https://uxtrata.freshdesk.com/solution/articles/30000026331-how-to-record-a-cash-deposit
  4. Cash Payment https://uxtrata.freshdesk.com/solution/articles/30000026333-how-to-record-a-cash-payment

Once you are done, select Insert.


Or,

Select Import.


Step 4:

Select Save to confirm changes.
solution-article.title: How to Perform a Bank Reconciliation

solution-article.desc-un-html:
Step 1: Enter the Unit Plan menu from the home page. Step 2: Select Add. Step 3: Fill in all the information. Type: Principal- main apartment/unit, Common- any common area, Accessories- accessory unit e.g. carpark, storage locker etc.
Known As: if unit has a different name to its legal title.
Proprietor: the owner of the unit. Enter Special Scale if there is one. Tick Committee box if the proprietor is a member of the committee, this will allow special functionality for them. Tick Tenant box if they have a tenant. Step 4: Select Save to confirm changes.
solution-article.description:
Step 1:



Enter the Unit Plan menu from the home page.

Step 2:


Select Add.

Step 3:

  • Fill in all the information.
  • Type: Principal- main apartment/unit, Common- any common area, Accessories- accessory unit e.g. carpark, storage locker etc.
  • Known As: if unit has a different name to its legal title.
  • Proprietor: the owner of the unit.
  • Enter Special Scale if there is one.
  • Tick Committee box if the proprietor is a member of the committee, this will allow special functionality for them.
  • Tick Tenant box if they have a tenant.

Step 4:

Select Save to confirm changes.
solution-article.title: How To Add a Unit

solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1: Select Financial Reports from the home page. Step 2: Select the Period for the financial report that you want to create. Select the Year Begin date, this is the start of the financial period for this body corporate. Start Page Num is the page number of the first page of the report you wish to create. Step 3: Select the report that you wish to generate. Step 4: You can select: Print- the report will be opened in a new tab in the browser, select print or save as you wish. (Please ensure popups have not been blocked on your browser). Export PDF- the report will be saved as a PDF file onto your computer.
solution-article.description:
Step 1:

Select Financial Reports from the home page.

Step 2:

  • Select the Period for the financial report that you want to create.
  • Select the Year Begin date, this is the start of the financial period for this body corporate.
  • Start Page Num is the page number of the first page of the report you wish to create.

Step 3:

Select the report that you wish to generate.

Step 4:

You can select:

  1. Print- the report will be opened in a new tab in the browser, select print or save as you wish. (Please ensure popups have not been blocked on your browser).
  2. Export PDF- the report will be saved as a PDF file onto your computer.
solution-article.title: How To Create a Financial Report [Single]

solution-article.desc-un-html:
Step 1: Select Financial Reports from the home page. Step 2: Select the Period for the financial report that you want to create. Select the Year Begin date, this is the start of the financial period for this body corporate. Start Page Num is the page number of the first page of the report you wish to create. Step 3: Select the reports that you wish to generate. Step 4: You can select:
Print- the reports will be opened in separate tabs in the browser for each report selected.
Export PDF- the reports will be saved as one PDF file on the computer.

solution-article.title: How To Create a Financial Report [Multiple]

solution-article.desc-un-html: Step 1: Select Financial Reports from the home page. Step 2: Select the Period for the financial report that you want to create. Select the Year Begin date, this is the start of the financial period for this body corporate. Start Page Num is the page number of the first page of the report you wish to create. Step 3: Tick Account Activity box. Select Multi Select. Step 4: Select accounts for which you wish to view the account activity. Step 5: You can select: Print- account activity reports will be opened in a new tab in the browser, select print or save as you wish. Export PDF- account activity reports will be saved as PDF file on your computer.
solution-article.description:
Step 1:


Select Financial Reports from the home page.

Step 2:

  • Select the Period for the financial report that you want to create.
  • Select the Year Begin date, this is the start of the financial period for this body corporate.
  • Start Page Num is the page number of the first page of the report you wish to create.

Step 3:

Tick Account Activity box.

Select Multi Select.

Step 4:

Select accounts for which you wish to view the account activity.

Step 5:

You can select:

  1. Print- account activity reports will be opened in a new tab in the browser, select print or save as you wish.
  2. Export PDF- account activity reports will be saved as PDF file on your computer.
solution-article.title: How to Create Multiple Account Activity Reports
